page.title: 13ROADWORKS ON THE M1
page.content: At Upper Heyford, Tarmac Construction have had a depot for the reconstruction of the M1. The M1 had a design life based on the traffic it was expected to carry. It was built in 1959 and it has lasted 6 more years than it was meant to. Also with the increase in traffic and the weight of the lorries the M1 has carried 5 times the traffic it was meant to carry. The existing motorway {pavement} has not been able to accept the very heavy traffic load and it is breaking up. The drains and culverts and the bridges are being damaged by rain and road salt. Tarmac started work on one 10 mile section of the carriageway on the 2nd March 85 and finished work on the 23rd June; it cost 7 million pounds. They worked in shifts, 24 hrs a day, 7 days a week. There were 20 staff & up to 160 machine operators & labourers involved.
